item.title: This isn't a server, so i decided to post help here
item.dc:creator: @Ags_Rush Ags Rush
item.description:
@Ags_Rush wrote:

[code]import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class GasCalculator {

public static void main(String[] args) {

	/* Strings, Ints, and Doubles */
	String distance, price, gas;
	int miles, dollars, gallons;
	double fuel, cost;

	/* Input Statements */
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, " Zach's Gas Calculator ");
		distance = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, " Enter the total distance you are traveling on your trip.");
			miles = Integer.parseInt(distance);
		price = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, " Enter the price of gas to the nearest gallon. ");
			dollars = Integer.parseInt(price);
		gas = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(null, " Enter the estimated gallons to the mile your car gets. ");
			gallons = Integer.parseInt(gallons);

	/* Calculations */
	fuel = miles / gallons;
	cost = fuel * dollars;

	/* Output */
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, " The total gas price for your trip will be " + cost + ".");
	System.exit(0);
}

}[/code]

gives me this error:

[code]C:\Users\Zach\Desktop\GasCalculator.java:19: error: no suitable method found for parseInt(int)
gallons = Integer.parseInt(gallons);
^
method Integer.parseInt(String) is not applicable
(actual argument int cannot be converted to String by method invocation conversion)
method Integer.parseInt(String,int) is not applicable
(actual and formal argument lists differ in length)
1 error

Tool completed with exit code 1
[/code]

I’m pretty sure the method is right.

Read full topic
